publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3610 Robert Brown: Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002—That the Parliament welcomes Carers’ Rights Day on 3 December 2002; pays tribute to the estimated 105,000 people in the Greater Glasgow area that act as carers to people that are sick, frail or disabled; applauds the efforts of Carers UK and local care organisations to support the position of carers, and calls on all levels of government to ensure that carers obtain all the benefits and support available to them.
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Irene McGugan*

S1M-3610 Robert Brown: Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002—That the Parliament welcomes Carers’ Rights Day on 3 December 2002; pays tribute to the estimated 105,000 people in the Greater Glasgow area that act as carers to people that are sick, frail or disabled; applauds the efforts of Carers UK and local care organisations to support the position of carers, and calls on all levels of government to ensure that carers obtain all the benefits and support available to them. Supported by: Irene McGugan, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Kay Ullrich*, Alex Neil*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Johann Lamont*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Pauline McNeill*, Bill Butler*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-3610 Carers' Rights Day - 3 December 2002 (lodged on 20 November 2002) Andrew Wilson*
